dialogue_history.speaker: Specialist (Neurologist)

Annual influenza and pneumococcal vaccination are recommended, especially if immunosuppression is anticipated; live vaccines should be avoided if immunosuppressed. 3. Encourage moderate, non-fatiguing physical activity as tolerated, with rest as needed, and advise patients to avoid overheating and excessive exertion.

dialogue_history.speaker: Specialist (Oncologist)
dialogue_history.text: Clinically, phyllodes tumors often present as large, rapidly growing, well-circumscribed, mobile masses, sometimes more so than carcinomas, but overlap is significant and tissue diagnosis is essential. MRI is most valuable for lesion localization and extent; phyllodes/sarcoma may show well-defined, lobulated masses with heterogeneous enhancement, but these features are not definitive—biopsy remains the gold standard if imaging is inconclusive.
